column8: C1. Mitochondrial donation is a treatment more like an organ transplant, which doesn't really change the genetics of person.
column9: C2. It's a slippery slope from genome editing for medical reasons to using it for other reasons.
column10: C3. Parents and guardians have a right to edit the genes of their children before they are born.
column11: C4. Parents want 'designer babies' with certain traits out of vanity.
column12: C5. I'm concerned that genome editing will lead to a reduction in genetic diversity.
column13: C6. I think it would be amazing to have a choice in the way someone behaves.
column14: C7. The idea that genome editing can make perfect people and societies is extremely dangerous.
column15: C8. I think it's okay to use genome editing to change someone's appearance.
column16: C9. I'm concerned that genome editing will be used as a quick techno-fix without actually dealing with real problems.
column17: C10. My concern is that as we start to tinker with the human genome, we're going to accidentally introduce a whole host of other problems.
column18: C11. If human genome editing is available then it should be available to everyone who needs it, not just those who can afford it.
column19: C12. I'm worried that human genome editing will widen the gap between those who can afford it and those who can't.
column20: C13. If we open the box of genome editing we will not know where to draw the line.
column21: C14. I am concerned that the use of human genome editing will advantage one group over another.
column22: C15. Decisions about the use of genome editing are best left to the experts.
column23: C16. If human genome editing can be used to make changes to humans on demand for any reason, the future will be like a dystopian movie.
column24: C17. Genome editing is really cool science.
column25: C18. Genome editing will be used for enhancement by wealthy people.
column26: C19. I have a more positive feeling about gene editing in humans than I do for animals or plants.
column27: C20. Editing genes that will be inherited is problematic because it means making decisions for future people who don't exist yet.
column28: C21. My cultural beliefs make me cautious about genome editing.
column29: C22. When you change someone's genes you are fundamentally changing who they are.
column30: C23. Genome editing in agriculture will have the biggest impact on people's health.
column31: C24. Anything that's been artificially created in a lab gives me Frankenstein vibes.
column32: C25. I worry that something will go wrong with genome technology.
column33: C26. It's better to use genome editing to prevent a serious disease from happening rather than having to treat it with conventional medicine after it has occurred.
column34: C27. The idea that people with genetic conditions might get cured in my lifetime is miraculous and incredible.
column35: C28. Genome editing technologies gives us power over human life itself.
column36: C29. Suggesting genome editing will 'cure' disability diminishes those living with genetic conditions who need support.
column37: C30. There is nothing wrong with using genome editing to speed up evolution and help living things (including humans) adapt to challenges.
column38: C31. As a society, we have an obligation to help strengthen coming generations by eradicating diseases.
column39: C32. We find strength when we face illness and adversity. It makes us who we are.
column40: C33. If genome editing is proven to be safe, then I see no reason to oppose it.
column41: C34. It is better to accept our genes the way they are than to tamper with things we don't understand.
column42: C35. I would consider using genome editing for my children to give them an advantage in life, so long as it's safe.
column43: C36. I don't think we know enough about genetic diseases or the long term consequences of genome editing
column44: C37. I think we should keep an open mind about new discoveries.
column45: C38. I would be OK with having my own genome edited.
column46: C39. Each individual has a right to decide for themselves whether to undergo gene editing, as long as the changes cannot be passed on to future generations.
column47: C40. Interfering in people's genes is intervening a bit too far in human creation.
column48: C41. The idea of editing the human genome is scary.
column49: C42. The use of gene editing for non-medical reasons reminds me of the Nazis during the Second World War.
column50: C43. Science and technology have too much control over our lives.
column51: C44. Beacause of our changing environments, I believe that future humans will need genome editing to survive.
column52: C45. I believe we should remain as natural as possible but we should not shy away from furthering medicine and the chance to save lives.
